events.name: Building a Strong Network of Women in Tech
events.description: Hello ladies, it's time to meet up! The first event of our women in tech meeting will take place at: School of Economics and Social Sciences, Singapore Management University 90 Stamford Road, Level 2 Singapore[masked] The purpose of the meeting will be to get to learn about new technologies, get to know each other, network, and have fun. There will also be a space to post jobs or advertise yourself as a job seeker. Food and soft drinks will be kindly provided by our sponsor, Teralytics Pte. Ltd. Program: 6:00pm  Welcome 6:15 - 6:45pm Deriving Insights from Telecommunication using Scala / Spark applications (Dr. Javiera Guedes, Teralytics) 6:50 - 7:20 pm Female Founders - An Investors Perspective (Anne Marie Droste) 7:30 - 8pm Challenges and biases faced by women in Tech (Dr. Javiera Guedes) 8 - 10pm Networking / Job Board If you would like to give a talk at our Meetup up about what you are doing, don't hesitate to contact me. Food and drinks will be provided by Teralytics. See you soon, ladies!
events.location: School of Economics & Social Sciences, Singapore Management University, 90 Stamford Road, Level 2

events.name: Data Analytics For Solving Real Business Problems
events.description:
RSVP for free here: ga.co/29B2KC6

Speakers:
Pavel Bulowski (Business Intelligence Partner, Keboola)
Alan Thornton (Senior Business Development, Experian)
Vinny Vijeyakumaar (Co-founder & Managing Partner, Sparkline)
Ainun Najib (Head of Data, Traveloka)

What makes a good company great? In the rapidly changing startup and technology market, great companies have the ability to respond and react to changes quicker than their competitors. Their edge is the ability to analyse data.

That is why data science and big data have become such a valuable skill to have in any company’s portfolio.

We have assembled a panel of speakers who will discuss their competitive edge at companies which utilise data science in smart ways. By the time you leave, you will equipped with knowledge, tools and resources to give your company a substantial edge in the competition.

events.name: On-going: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.description: Study group for the Coursera Functional Programming in Scala Specialization, and all of it's courses.  Anyone may attend regardless of your progress in the courses.  We're here to help. If you have not already, please make sure that you have signed up for the courses you are interested in, on Coursera. <a>Functional Programming in Scala5-course Specialization·École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne</a> It's a good idea to have your development environment set up, before attending.  You can find instructions within the courses themselves.
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: Ruby Code Reading Group #2: Concurrent Ruby
events.description:
Hi everyone! The "How does it work?" meetup was inspired by Guo Xiang's suggestion to have a meetup talk about how Sprockets actually works. 


After the first meetup we decided to vote about the topic for next month. The chosen option was Concurrent Ruby, a toolset that provides a bunch of higher-level abstractions for concurrency in Ruby. Concurrent Ruby is a big library, therefore we decided to pick just a part of it to discuss and learn together how it works 


Preparation 1. Download code from https://github.com/ruby-concurrency/concurrent-ruby 2. Read the description and code of promise feature. https://github.com/ruby-concurrency/concurrent-ruby/blob/master/lib/concurrent/promise.rb 3. Read the description and code of async feature. https://github.com/ruby-concurrency/concurrent-ruby/blob/master/lib/concurrent/async.rb 



Meetup plan We meet at 7.30pm and start by discussing how promises work. Everyone can participate, show some example and explain how the code works. Everyone can ask questions whenever something is not clear. Depending on the length of the first part, we'll try to cover async feature as well. 


Venue Sponsor

events.name: Java Technology in Life Science world
events.description: Muntasir Rahman, a technologist who is working for Thermo Fisher Scientific, a biotech company, will help us understand the role of technology within Life science domain, and what interesting problems they are trying to solve  Topics :  What are the problems to be solved in Life Science industry  What Java technologies  used  What skillsets are high in demand within this industry How is the future for technologist working in Biotech / Life Sciences

events.name: Native Hadoop Solution for Ingesting Big Data from Multiple Sources using Apex
events.description: Presenter - Dr Sandeep Deshmukh, Committer Apache Apex, DataTorrent engineer Abstract:  Ingesting and extracting data from Hadoop can be a frustrating, time consuming activity for many enterprises. Apache Apex Data Ingestion is a standalone big data application that simplifies the collection, aggregation and movement of large amounts of data to and from Hadoop for a more efficient data processing pipeline. Apache Apex Data Ingestion makes configuring and running Hadoop data ingestion and data extraction a point and click process enabling a smooth, easy path to your Hadoop-based big data project. In this series of talks, we would cover how Hadoop Ingestion is made easy using Apache Apex. The first talk in this series would focus on ingesting unbounded file data. We will also give a brief overview of the Apex platform at the beginning of the session. Please register for the webinar at: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/368563270490110724 After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar. Apache Apex is a next generation native Hadoop data in motion platform that is being used by customers for both streaming as well as batch processing. Common use cases include ingestion into Hadoop, streaming analytics, ETL, database off-loads, alerts and monitoring, machine model scoring, etc. Apache Apex completely separates operational logic from business logic, and handles all operational aspects. This enables developers to concentrate on business logic and reduce time to market as well as total cost of ownership.  For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - follow ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download (community, sandbox), Apache Apex releases, docs  This webcast is of an Big Data Ingest & Transform meetup event done earlier in Pune, IN and we are webcasting it enable other Ingestors to participate. If you are interested in helping to organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) the Big Data Ingest & Transform (next gen Hadoop) community, please email <a>[masked]</a>
events.group_name: Big Data (Next Gen Hadoop) Ingest & Transform, Singapore
